document_title: Sleep disorders: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Sleep disorders can be prevented by following a healthy lifestyle schedule. Accordingly, to limit sleep disorders you need to pay attention to:
Maintain a sleep-wake schedule at a certain time;; Do not use electronic devices at least 1 hour before bed;; Avoid stressful factors that cause nervous stimulation (especially before bed);; Maintain a reasonable weight, supplement all necessary nutrients;; Do not use alcohol; cigarette; foods high in sugar, foods containing caffeine in the late afternoon or evening;; Limit foods high in fat and indigestible oils before bed;; Exercise and exercise regularly;; Drink some water before going to bed;
